question: In a particular code language 'ABASEMENT' is written as 'EECTEIBLS' then how 'ABANDONED' is written in that language?

Which number will replace the question mark (?) in the following number series?

256, 123, 66, ?, 18, 6

Directions: Study the following information carefully and answer the given questions:

A word, symbol and number arrangement machine when given an input line of words, symbols and numbers rearranges them following a particular rule. The following is an illustration of input and rearrangement. (All the numbers are single-digit numbers).

Input: 6 @ Great 4 Dance $ 1

Step I: @ Great 4 Dance $ 1 6

Step II: 4 Great @ Dance 6 1 $

Step III: Great 4 @ Dance 6 $ 1

And Step III is the last step of the above input, as the desired arrangement is obtained.

As per the rule followed in the above steps, find out in each of the following questions the appropriate step for the given input.

Input: 2 & Car 3 Drive # 5

Question: Which word/number/symbol would be at 4th position from the right in Step III?

Johnson's current age is 1/5 of his father's age. Five years earlier, Johnson's father's age was 2 years more than 8 times Johnson's age. What is the present age (in years) of Johnson and his father respectively?
Find the minimum number of straight lines required to make the given figure.
'Chapter' is related to 'Book' in the same way as 'Compartment' is related to '_______'.

POWER : TGYQR :: TRAIN : ?

BA, ED, IH, NM, ________

Study the following information carefully and answer the given questions:

If ‘P # Q’ means ‘P is the wife of Q’

If ‘P % Q’ means ‘P is the husband of Q’

If ‘P & Q’ means ‘P is the son of Q’

If ‘P * Q’ means ‘P is the sister of Q’
If ‘B % E * G; I & G # N; S & I’ is given, then how is S related to N?

Directions: Study the information carefully and answer the given questions.
9 friends – A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, and I, stand height-wise in a line. Only 3 people are shorter than G, who is just shorter than D. 3 people are between I and B, who is taller than only 2 people. F is taller than both I and A, but is not the tallest. E is taller than H, but shorter than A. C is taller than F. Who is the 3rd tallest of the group?

In a certain code language - "Harsh is a king" is written as "78 79 69 80", "King is royal" is written as "69 81 79", "Royal are best" is written as "81 90 91" and "best are Harsh" is written as "91 78 90".

What is the code for "Harsh is a royal"?
After preparing long for competitive exams, you failed to clear any. Your father wants you to help in earning the bread. You will
option_1: Look for some job in the private sector.
option_2: Start giving tuitions to help your father.
option_3: Start tuitions and burn the midnight oil for preparation.
option_4: Continue with your preparation more sincerely.

question:
Read the following question and decide which of the given statements is/are sufficient to answer the question.

What is the colour of human blood?

Statements:

1. Blue is called pink, red is called orange and orange is called yellow.

2. White is called black, black is called green, green is called brown and brown is called red.
option_1: Either 1 or 2 is sufficient to answer the given question.
option_2: 1 alone is sufficient while 2 alone is not sufficient to answer the given question.
option_3: Both 1 and 2 together are sufficient to answer the given question.
option_4: 2 alone is sufficient while 1 alone is not sufficient to answer the given question.

question:
Which two signs should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?

459 + 17 × 12 ÷ 72 - 47 = 349

Study the following information carefully and answer the following questions.

Dhawan plans to buy a flat at Shyamla Society.

Shyamala Society has placed the following conditions for allotment of flats in its society:

Applicant:

(I). State domicile certificate must be submitted.

(II). Must have done a job of at least 5 years.

(III). If needed, he will be ready to pay the entire amount in 5 years.

(IV). Should not be the owner or co-owner (if spouse) of the residential facility in that city

(V). Should not be below 35 years of age as on 31 December 2016.

 In the case of the applicant who fulfils all other criteria except:

A) (I) As mentioned above, should be referred to the chairman of the city council.

B) (II) As mentioned above, prepared to provide Aadhaar card. To be referred to the vice-chairman of the committee

C) (III) As mentioned above, but a freedom fighter or ex-soldier or the first relationship with these should be referred to a member of the committee.

The last date for receipt of applications was 31 December 2016. The conditions of 31 December 2016 are to be met. Based on these criteria, decide whether you have to allot the flat in the following case given on 1 January 2017.

Dhawan is an industrialist and from another state who established his factory in 2000 and has a state residence certificate. He is ready to pay the full amount in 4 years if necessary. He does not have a house in that city but his wife has a flat. His date of birth is 11 November 1970.
option_2: Send for consideration to the Vice President.
option_4: Send to the President for consideration.

question: Four option are given in the question, three of them are similar in some way and one is different. Find the odd one.

Seven teachers Anil, Kamal, Ram, Sanjay, Aakash, Vivek and Rahul are sitting around a circular table facing opposite to the centre (not necessarily in the same order). Sanjay is to the immediate right of Anil. Anil is third to the right of Rahul. Vivek is not the immediate neighbour of Aakash. Kamal is second to the right of Vivek. Who is second to the right of Anil?
You work in ABC company and one of your female colleagues is always harassed by his senior. She has asked you to help her. You will
option_1: Directly ask your senior regarding it.
option_2: Investigate the matter and if it is true, question him.
option_4: Investigate, collect proofs and go to higher authorities.

question: Select the option that is embedded in the given figure (X) (Rotation is NOT allowed).

Complete the series choosing the missing letters:

pqrp__qq__rppp__qqr__r__qrppq__rr
option_1: p, r, p, r, q, p
option_2: p, q, r, p, q, r
option_3: p, p, q, q, r, r
option_4: p, r, q, r, p, q

question:
Direction: In the question below are given three statements followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and III. You have to take the given statements to be true even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts. Read all the conclusions and then decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the given statements disregarding commonly known facts.

Statements:

All hens are pigeon.

No pigeon is crow.

All crows are peacock.

Conclusions:

No hen is a crow.

All hens are being peacock is possibility.
Evaluate the following expression: ∣5×(15−5)+20÷5−50∣ mod 6

Directions: In the question below a statement is given followed by two conclusions, I and II. You have to consider the statement to be true, even if it seems to be at variance from commonly known facts. You have to decide which of the given conclusions definitely is drawn from the given statement.

Statement: Sarvika has scored the highest marks in the board exam in her state including all streams.

Conclusions:

I. Sarvika has scored the highest marks in her school.

II. Sarvika is not interested in sports.
option_3: Both conclusion I and II follows
option_4: Either conclusion I or II follows

question:
Read the statements and choose the 'cause statement' and 'effect statements':

Statement - A: The Government has increased the prices of petrol and diesel by 10% with immediate effect.

Statement - B: The oil producing countries have decided to decrease the oil production level significantly.
option_2: Statement 'B' is a cause and 'A' is effect

Varun and Vijay invested Rs. 2500 and Rs. 3250 into a business and after x and (12 - x) months they invested Rs. 1000 and Rs. 750 more respectively. If at the end of the year Varun got Rs. 380 out of total annual profit of Rs. 800, Then find the value of 'x'.

There is a chord of a circle of length 42 cm. Perpendiculars from the midpoint C of the chord are drawn on the either side touch the circle at P and Q. If CP < CQ and CP is 9 cm, then what is the length of CQ?

Noopur is the owner of a perfume shop, She first gave a discount of 19% on the marked price of the perfume but realized that she was making a loss of 10% so she reduced the discount and started giving a 5% discount. Determine her current profit or loss percentage.

Ajay lent a certain amount of money to Vinod at simple interest on a certain agreement. Ajay offers 20 percent per annum for first 2 years, 8 percent per annum for the next 3 years and 10 percent for beyond 5 years. Vinod paid ₹ 147200 at the end of 7 years. What is the amount borrowed by Vinod from Ajay?

The following tables gives the frequency distribution of number of peas per pea pod of 198 pods:

 Number of peas 1 2 3 4 5 6 7
 Frequency 4 33 76 50 26 8 1 
What is the median of this distribution?

The students in three batches of a dance class are in ratio 2 : 3 : 5. If 20 students increase in each batch the ratio changes to 4 : 5 : 7. Find the total number of students in the three batches before the increase.

Three students of class VIII participated in a race during a school sports day. In a 1 km race, A wins the race with B by 100 m, and in a 300 m race, B beats C by 50 m. Then in the race of 1 km, with what margin will A beat C?
In ΔPQR, QS ⊥ PR, RT ⊥ PQ and QS and RT intersect each other at O. The bisector of ∠OQR and ∠ORQ meet at the same point M. If ∠QPR = 56°, then what is the measure of ∠QMR?

A mixed juice was prepared by mixing orange, apple and pineapple juices in the ratio 18 ∶ 16 ∶ 3 respectively. On adding 8 litres of orange juice and 4 litres of pineapple juice, the ratio of mixed juice changes to 5 ∶ 4 ∶ 1. How much apple juice should be further added to it, so that the ratio of mixed juice becomes 10 ∶ 9 ∶ 2?
There are 50 students in a class. The average marks of 20 students is 70 and the remaining 30 have average marks of 80. Calculate the average score of the whole class.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.

Abominable

In this section, each item consists of six sentences of a passage. The first and the sixth sentences are given as S1 and S6. The middle four sentences in each have been jumbled up and labelled as P, Q, R, and S. You are required to find the proper sequence of the four sentences and mark your response accordingly on the Answer Sheet. 

S1: Guru Nanak Jayanti is an essential festival for Sikhs

P: On this day, Guru Nanak was born, so it is important for Sikhism

Q: As the Sikh religion is spread throughout the world, people who belong to it celebrate the day like a festival with a lot of joy and happiness

R: With great joy and enthusiasm all over the world

S: It is popularly known as Gurpurab, and the Sikhs celebrate it

S6: Sikhs commemorate this day to remember the essential teachings of Guru Nanak and follow them rigorously.

Direction: Change the sentence from direct speech to indirect speech.

The king said to his servant, "Cook me some delicious food today."
option_1: The king ordered to his servant to cook me some delicious food that day.
option_2: The king ordered his servant to cook him some delicious food today.
option_3: The king ordered his servant to cook him some delicious food that day.
option_4: The king ordered his servant that he cooks some delicious food for him that day.

question:
Directions: The question below consist of a set of labelled sentences. Out of four options given, select the most logical order of the sentences which form a paragraph.

The Taj Mahal is located on the right bank of the Yamuna River in a vast Mughal garden that encompasses nearly 17 hectares, in the Agra District in Uttar Pradesh.

P. It was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal with construction starting in 1632 AD and completed in 1648 AD,

Q. The mosque, the guest house and the main gateway on the south, the outer courtyard and its cloisters were added subsequently and completed in 1653 AD.

R. The existence of several historical and Quranic inscriptions in Arabic script have facilitated setting the chronology of Taj Mahal.

S. For its construction, masons, stone-cutters, inlayers, carvers, painters, calligraphers, dome builders and other artisans were requisitioned from the whole of the empire and also from the Central Asia and Iran.

Ustad-Ahmad Lahori was the main architect of the Taj Mahal.

Choose the option which can be substituted for the given words/sentence.

one who delights in speaking about oneself

A sentence has been given with a blank to be filled with an appropriate option. Choose the correct alternative.

I strained ______ to catch his options.

Directions: In this section, the item consists of six sentences of a passage. The first and the sixth sentences are given in the beginning as S1 and S6. The middle four sentences in each have been jumbled up and labeled as P, Q, R, and S. You are required to find the proper sequence of the four sentences and mark your response accordingly on the Answer Sheet.

S1 : Obesity is a chronic disorder that involves an excessive amount of body fat which isn't just a cosmetic concern.

S6 : Obese patients were reported with severe coronavirus illness and a poor outcome as compared to normal individuals.

 P : But also involves health problems such as heart diseases, diabetes, high blood pressure, severe arthritis, and even certain cancers.

 Q : Innumerable co-morbidities are associated with obesity like hypertension, diabetes, ischemic heart disease, fatty liver, liver cirrhosis, gall stones, acidity, stroke, cancers, osteoporosis, infertility, and psychological trauma.

 R : It is a public health crisis worldwide where one-third of the world population suffers from it and reportedly about 1 in 5 children and more than 1 in 3 adults struggle with it.

 S : Obesity becomes serious as it associates with poorer mental health outcomes and reduced quality of life and even during the Covid-19 pandemic.

The correct sequence should be:

Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
She is married ______ a diamond merchant.
Choose the sentence with no spelling error.
option_1: Peel and pit avocados and cut into slice
option_2: Peel and pit avacados and cut into slice.
option_3: Peal and pitt avocados and cut into slise.
option_4: Peale and pit avocados and cut into slise.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

Zonk out
option_1: To become more alert and awake
option_2: To experience a burst of energy
option_3: To fall asleep suddenly or unexpectedly
option_4: To engage in intense physical activity

question:
In the following question, there are six sentences marked S1, S6, P, Q, R, S. The positions of S1 and S6 are fixed. You are required to choose one of the four alternatives which would be the most logical sequence of the sentence in the passage.

S1. This year many States have been badly affected by the drought situation prevailing.

P: No better is the situation elsewhere, where floods have ravaged the standing crop.

Q: Though some have been less affected, even these are facing an uphill task in managing the situation.

R: Especially pitiable is the plight of the poor farmer who cannot afford a tubewell to irrigate his land.

S: Here the predicament is more equitable, for everybody's land is similarly submerged under ten feet of water.

S6. Either way, it seems the lot of the Indian farmer to be at the mercy of the elements.

Which of the following statements about brown noise is/are correct according to the passage?

A. Brown noise is associated with lower frequencies and has a deeper, more condensed sound compared to white noise.
B. White noise and brown noise are fundamentally similar in composition, differing only in volume.
C. Brown noise has been linked with improved sleep quality for individuals who struggle with silence.
option_1: Only A and B are correct
option_2: Only A and C are correct
option_3: Only B and C are correct
option_4: All A, B, and C are correct

question:
Evaluate the truth of the following statements in light of the passage:

A. Pink noise is favoured over brown noise in search trends across the United States.
B. Brown noise is often described using analogies to natural or environmental phenomena.
C. Both Castel and Rose found brown noise more tolerable than white noise.
option_1: Only A and B are correct
option_2: Only B and C are correct
option_3: Only A and C are correct
option_4: All A, B, and C are correct

question:
Determine which of the following statements aligns with Ziff’s experience and viewpoint:

A. Ziff’s preference for brown noise is rooted in its ability to mask both internal and external disruptions.
B. He found traditional white noise machines to be highly effective in treating his sleep issues.
C. Brown noise provided a solution tailored to his sensory sensitivities and mental health needs.
option_1: Only A and C are correct
option_2: Only B and C are correct
option_3: Only A and B are correct
option_4: All A, B, and C are correct

question: What can be inferred about the shift from white and pink noise to brown noise?
option_1: Technological improvements made brown noise more accessible than pink noise.
option_2: Users’ dissatisfaction with high-frequency sounds led them to explore deeper, more soothing alternatives.
option_3: Brown noise is clinically proven to be more effective than pink and white noise.
option_4: White and pink noise are now obsolete due to the rise of brown noise.

question: What conclusion can be drawn from the experiences of the individuals quoted in the passage?
option_1: Personal preference plays a major role in the effectiveness of auditory sleep aids.
option_2: Brown noise is universally more beneficial than other types of sound therapy.
option_3: The scientific community unanimously supports brown noise for mental health management.
option_4: Sound therapy is ineffective without visual and environmental cues.
